website_summaries.verdict: Coffee purists and camping enthusiasts alike are thrilled with this stovetop percolator, with both 8-cup and 12-cup sizes available for well under $50.
pros: Classic-looking pot is made of heavy-duty stainless steel
Handle stays cool, and clear knob on the top indicates when the coffee starts perking
Can use either fresh grounds or pre-ground coffee
Paper filters aren't needed
Surface doesn’t tarnish, even when using over an open fire
cons: Takes longer than some other methods to brew
percolator newbies may need some trial and error to get it right

website_summaries.verdict: This percolator can be used indoors and out, and comes with a handle that stays cool to the touch.
pros: Comes in an 8-cup or 12-cup size
Comes with its own filter
Handle does not get hot when coffee pot is on the heat
Can work as well at home as on the road
Relatively thick stainless steel material used
cons: Comes with a plastic rather than glass top
Not made to set completely in an open fire

website_summaries.verdict: This is vintage coffeemaking at its best. The percolator is equally at home in the kitchen or at a campsite.
pros: Affordable
Among the best of the traditional coffee percolators
Works well with all heat sources: electric, natural gas, propane
cons: Smaller 8-cup capacity may not appeal to heavy coffee drinkers
Percolating coffee manually has a steep learning curve, so close supervision may be required

website_summaries.verdict: A highly-rated, affordable coffee percolator for classic stove top percolating.
pros: Brews 4 to 8 cups on your stove top
Saves the headache of an electric unit breaking down
Made from heavy-duty stainless steel with a polished, much-admired traditional look
Filter basket is made from stainless steel and no paper filters required
Loved for camping trips
We recommend using a light or medium roast, as a dark roast tends to have a burnt quality
Makes hot and the “best” tasting coffee as rated by fans of this perking method
cons: Does not work on induction stove top
A bit of a learning curve to make coffee properly

customer_reviews.title: No better coffee than camp coffee
customer_reviews.text: I got this for camping because my parents always had one for camping a loved it. It's the usual percolator set-up, and performs perfectly. It's also big enough to easily heat water for washing dishes when breakfast is over. Just fill it up, heat it up, and mix it with cold water in your wash bucket. Essential to a family camper.
customer_reviews.author: Dyreka Klaus

customer_reviews.title: I was a little shocked when the item was delivered ...
customer_reviews.text: I was a little shocked when the item was delivered in the box that you would see on the store shelf. My concerns were justified when I opened it up and found the glass piece on top was broken. The piece that broke off was no where in the box. I am returning the item and will probably not repurchase. The item was not constructed very well in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: FMiller

customer_reviews.title: Makes terrific coffee!
customer_reviews.text: This is our camping coffee maker. It rocks! Sometimes we even use it at home on the weekends :)
customer_reviews.author: Tommygun

customer_reviews.title: Love this product, but you should know this.
customer_reviews.text: Love making coffee in this pot. When I see coffee percolating it feels so nostalgic! I have two issues with this pot. First, the number levels inside the pot are extremely difficult to see. I can deal with that. Second (and most importantly) is that the glass bulb does not stay tight and secure on the top of the pot. I screw it on until it feels tight and secure, but when I go to remove the lid, the glass just comes out and it is quite difficult to pry the lid off. It seems like the glass notch on the side of the glass isn't big enough. Too bad because I love this coffee pot.
customer_reviews.author: sherri l wilson

customer_reviews.title: It's crap
customer_reviews.text: This thing sucks. The cheap plastic top broke 2 days after I started using the product. I didn't drop it or bump it or abuse it in any way. It just broke in half. Now it leaks and is next to useless. I would return it but that's more trouble than its worth. I guess you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: I waited a long time to order a pot like this and this one looked perfect
customer_reviews.text: I waited a long time to order a pot like this and this one looked perfect. Well I got it, and there is no lid in the box. I am so dissapointed as I saved money to order this ,and am on a fixed income . My son opened the box while I was gone and got it out and set it up..not even realizing the lid was no there. IPLEASE SEND ME A LID PLEASE SEND ME A LID I LOVE THE POT PLEASE SEND ME A LID FOR IT..Merri.. Please send the lid for this pot, as it shows a pot w/lid not just the pot.
customer_reviews.author: Merrilyn Mc Elderry

customer_reviews.title: Best coffee...Love it!
customer_reviews.text: After my old automatic drip, plug in coffee maker broke, I started looking for what types of coffeemakers were available. Did not want one that had plastic parts in contact with hot or even boiling water. tried a pour over filter type which I used to use, and it was ok, not easy to keep it warm. This stainless steel percolater coffee pot makes delicious coffee, Ummmm, nice and strong ! Very easy to make and clean. Good price, too. Best coffee I have made in a long time. Love it!!
customer_reviews.author: McLeSk

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Failure
customer_reviews.text: First it blew the lid off, I fixed that by increasing lid spring tension. Then it blew coffee out the spout, I fixed that by replacing riser spring with two SS nuts. Now it's developed a pin hole in the bottom, leaking coffee onto the glass stove top. Beautiful pot, great name, but this failure is headed for the landfill! Oh by the way I am not over heating the pot, just enough to make it perk. Bad design, tissue thin bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Moose

customer_reviews.title: Makes amazing coffee!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this percolator. Coffee is amazing and makes my whole house smell so good! It really makes 12 cups!! I love coffee and most of the drip coffee pots are so big and take up so much room on my counter and I think they consider 6oz. a cup when they say 12 cups!! It is really a nice looking pot, also. I took the advice of a reviewer and don't use the knob on top to pull off the top, but rather life it from the sides with my fingers.
customer_reviews.author: Sandi

customer_reviews.title: Leaked
customer_reviews.text: Looked and felt better than previous coffee pots I had used but the first time I brewed coffee in it on a camping trip it leaked near the bottom. Looked like a tiny puncture and a companion on the trip said she knew someone with the same problem with a Farberwear coffee pot. I bought it too far in advance of my trip to return, but would not recommend this manufacturer again.
customer_reviews.author: allan bulgrin

customer_reviews.title: ARRIVED BROKEN - BAD EXPERIENCES WITH PERCOLATORS
customer_reviews.text: I love stove top percolators and finding a quality one is a challenge. The 8 cup pot is okay. The plastic top worked for 2 uses before it broke however I was able to find a one size fits all glass top which is working fine. Because we drink more coffee on the weekends, we decided to purchase the 12 cup. Jeesh, what a sad company. Do they even care about what they are shipping people? The top did not close tightly. And the coffee bin was bent and cracked on one side. I am beginning to tire of receiving damaged products. I ended up returning this pot and will search for my perfect stove top percolator from another website.
customer_reviews.author: Rene Bechard

customer_reviews.title: Worst coffee pot ever
customer_reviews.text: Worst coffee pot ever. This thing leaks like a 300 yr. old sailing Ship. I'm a perk guy and my 10 yr. old Copco pot is retiring. Used this 2X and I brought the old pot out of retirement to save my mornings. Keep this in the car trunk as a pot for tailgating where I don't care about the mess. Too lazy to send it back and don't want to deal w the hassle.
customer_reviews.author: frank p. sinatra

customer_reviews.title: Glass percolator knob broke in half.
customer_reviews.text: Well, I've only had it for a couple of weeks and only used it maybe a handful of times, and this morning, I pulled off the top to clean take the basket out and clean the pot, and half of the glass knob was sitting on top of the basket. I'm disappointed because I like the pot.
customer_reviews.author: J. Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Old-Fashioned Percolator
customer_reviews.text: I can remember my mom, and grandma making their coffee in a percolator when I was a boy. Unfortunately, I made my way through two Mister Coffees, and another stove top style device that melted, before coming upon this old fashioned percolator.. Since it pumps the water up through the tube, and into the coffee basket, the water goes through the coffee for the duration of the percolation process (5-7 minutes), not just once like Mr Coffee. So, the brewed coffee from this percolator is much more full-bodied, and rich Tasting. Though made in China, it seems to be a reasonable quality.
customer_reviews.author: grateful1

customer_reviews.title: Really dig my old school coffee pot!
customer_reviews.text: I am old school and grew up w/the coffee pots of yesteryear... to me, they produce amazing coffee. I was told by a friend that, Italians do not wash their espresso machines or coffee pots w/soap, so, I wash my pot w/a ratio of 50:50 water and white distilled vinegar; leaves my coffee pot like new and the coffee tastes great. Will not trade it for any of the modern stuff going on.
customer_reviews.author: TXCoffeeWmn

customer_reviews.title: EDIT
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. It makes a superior cup of coffee. I prefer the 1/1 ratio of cups to tablespoons and I use Cafe Bustelo brand coffee. It's sooo good. * Been using this product for about a week now. The top was advertised as plastic, it was however glass. Broke this morning. The replacements, which I did not purchase because I thought I would not need them with the top being plastic, cost more to ship than they cost to purchase for me (Alaska life :( ). So sad.
customer_reviews.author: joseph hicks

customer_reviews.title: Beware
customer_reviews.text: I was happy with this coffee pot. Much to my disappointment the glass knob on the lid broke so easily. Too easily. I was extra careful with it. I was so concerned about where did the fragments disappear to as I didn't see it break while washing. I purchased it August and now its October. Its been less than 3 months.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Larger than I expected
customer_reviews.text: We got it specifically for cowboy coffee. It's water and coffee grounds, boiled and then poured slowly or run through a filter, so as to not get a lot of grounds in your cup. The rolling boil is the critical part because it gets rid of the acid which causes the bitter taste. This pot is perfect for it. What we found is that the percolator does basically the same thing and there is little chance of grounds in your cup.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce

customer_reviews.title: The black plastic piece on the lid cracked into a bunch of tiny pieces after a few uses
customer_reviews.text: I used to love these things but this one was made with very poor quality materials. I purchased it only 2 weeks ago and it’s already broken. I’ve never had any problems with any of the old ones I had and this ones seal broke within just a few uses.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: This thing sucks !
customer_reviews.text: I honestly cannot stand this thing. Received it last week based on reviews. It takes to long and brews weak coffee. This morning it took 30 minutes to get to temperature on medium high heat, including 8 minutes of percolating time. With 10 tablespoons of coffee per 8 cups of water, it was totally weak. This was three days in a row ! I dumped it down the drain and ordered a French press
customer_reviews.author: ShawnH

customer_reviews.title: Rust present after 1⁄2 year of use.
customer_reviews.text: After 6 months of almost daily use, rust has begun on the inside of the spout. The plastic knob on the lid constantly becomes loose and has to be retightened. The spring that goes on the flange of the pump stem accidentally fell into the garbage disposal while I was washing the percolator and was ruined. Why not just make a longer stem that brings the basket closer to the knob? This product is made in China from China-sourced materials. And if you read the fine print on the description that accompanies the product, you'll find that this percolator is licensed by Farberware -- which does not translate into being manufactured by Farberware.
customer_reviews.author: BeenThereDoneThat

customer_reviews.title: I love this percolator except....
customer_reviews.text: This percolator is perfect in every way, except that the description said that it had a plastic top knob. That is why I ordered this one over other ones. Well, wouldn't you know it! After the first time using it the lid fell out of my hand and landed on the ground and the knob shattered. It's not plastic but glass! I did not return item because it was my fault that I dropped the lid. I ordered the yosemite plastic knob piece at $8. Now I have to wait 7-9 days for that to be delivered. So I can't use my percolator until then. Why would it say plastic knob and turn out to be glass?
customer_reviews.author: KG

customer_reviews.title: Glass thin as a Christmas ornament
customer_reviews.text: There are some nice features to this coffee pot but the glass bubble top is so cheap that it’s basically useless once it breaks and it will. Thin garbage glass topper that cracked during the first use for me and I’m not a Neanderthal. Simply screwing into the metal top without force caused it to break. Perhaps I had a defective topper but the glass is so thin it’s dollar foolish. What are they saving? I had no leaking for I checked that first because the bottom is seamed to the sides, a dent or two would probably break the seal.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph Del Pozzo

customer_reviews.title: Awsome stove top percolator!
customer_reviews.text: I love this stove top percolator! My electric percolator was getting old and the glass knob was leaking so I needed a new one. I couldn't find another electric one I liked so I bought this stove top one. After you figure out how much coffee grounds to use in this perc. It makes the best coffee! I bought a carafe at the same time also because you don't want to leave this perc. on the stove to keep the coffee hot. It does take longer to brew the coffee in the perc. but it is worth the wait!
customer_reviews.author: EJL

customer_reviews.title: 4 Stars, for now
customer_reviews.text: ☆ Delivery- ordered through Amazon on Saturday, delivered Monday. ☆ Condition upon Delivery- Components were individually placed in protective plastic bags, then packaged in assembled order with instructions in the shipping box. ☆ Look and performance- This product looks and feels like quality Stainless steel and composite plastic used on the handle and clear percolator topper. Unfortunately I have not yet used this product. ☆ Meets Expectaions- As far as size, look and feel, yes. ☆ Value for price- Looks and feels like a quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Tazla

customer_reviews.title: Nice Quality!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband to replace his coffee maker, and he loves it! He's never had a perculator before. Very nice quality and easy to clean. He also said it's super easy to reheat the coffee without ruining the flavor, like when he use to put his cup in the microwave.
customer_reviews.author: Cherp

customer_reviews.title: Coffee taste great!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great percolator! It is very sturdy and looks great! The reusable coffee basket works fabulously. No messy coffee filter. Very easy to use and clean. Used on a glass top electric stove and water boiled quickly coffee tasted great! I would say best cup of coffee I have had in a long time. I bought this for our new camper however the coffee is so good I’ll use it daily. Can’t wait to share a cup of coffee with friends who like myself use the kuerig due to time issues. It does take more time but the reward is so smooth and bold! I would recommend this percolator.
customer_reviews.author: Tanya

customer_reviews.title: Farberware Coffee Percolator to the Rescue!
customer_reviews.text: Well, I bought this Percolator because we have frequent Power Fluctuations and Power Outages. I love my Coffee and I don't want to have to do without just because the Power is Out ;-) Faberware Percolator to the Rescue! I chose this one because it is Stainless Steel so it can hold up to the Grill or Campfire. It also has a Glass Top instead of Resin as I've found those are the first things to break. The Power was Out Again so I fired up the Grill and Perked away. Ah, good Coffee ;-) I would buy it again. Happy Perking! See you in the Air! Ground Control RC (Search for us on Youtube for this Review and More)
customer_reviews.author: Ground Control RC

customer_reviews.title: Nice and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Pros: The steel is thick, so it seems it will wear well, but it's not too heavy to lift and pour even full. Does not overpower. Makes good coffee. Cons: First percolator I ever had with a spring below the basket ( not sure the purpose) It might be a weakness. For me, I'll probably lose the spring. Hard plastic(?) handle gets extremely hot. Why can't they come up with a handle i don't need a potholder for?
customer_reviews.author: Pat mulligan

customer_reviews.title: What I was looking for!
customer_reviews.text: I prefer it to my coffee pot! But the time does vary from the instructions depending on how strong or light you like your coffee to taste. I have came to the conclusion that my perfect coffee is at 15 mins to 18 mins depending on using decaf or regular roast.
customer_reviews.author: Amber Monroe

customer_reviews.title: Healthiest, safest way to brew coffee!
customer_reviews.text: Stainless steel and glass make this the healthiest way to brew coffee. No boiling hot pressurized water leaching out plastic/components of plastic into your coffee as with other methods to brew coffee. I do use filter discs to reduce sediment (also done by simply letting sit a few minutes after brewing and/or using coarse grind coffee) but these are not essential to use. Also if power is out or going camping? Just use it over a campstove! Percolated coffee is much higher in caffeine content as well. My mother has one from the 1960's-think about how many plastic coffee makers are in landfills over that time period!!!
customer_reviews.author: David Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service. Good percolator.
customer_reviews.text: My second Farberware percolater. When I put it together the knob didn't catch well, you felt it grab and then continue, something off in the knob or the lid. It falls off while pouring or trying to lift the lid. I called cusotmer care (1800 809 7166 in case someone else needs it) The knob will be replaced-I was even told that shipping might take a week because of location) and if that doesn't solve my issue, to call back and the pot will be replaced. I call that really good customer service. My previous pot was fine for a few years, until the plastic knob broke off into the pot. That's replaceable.
customer_reviews.author: Hoody

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Coffee Maker
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this percolator for over a year now, and it has been used two to three times every day. I have a large family with several coffee drinkers, and while it takes a bit more time to clean out the grounds before you can make coffee each time, the flavor far exceeds a drip coffee maker. We have had zero problems with durability, functionality, or anything else. it just plain works.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Not too shabby.. makes a mean cup of joe. worth every penny.
customer_reviews.text: I've been seeking the a way to make enough coffee for 2-3 that can last a morning and this is it. The coffee grind is best with a really rough grind (best using food-store grinders) and the taste is incredible. If you use the right grind, it makes the perfect cup. I never overheat or quick boil. It cleans and disassembles completely as well - so it's easy to maintain. The stainless steel is good quality with a good shine too it, but it feels relatively thin/light. It's the right balance of price and durability - and I love it.
customer_reviews.author: John Silvia

customer_reviews.title: KISS applied to a perculator for a great brew
customer_reviews.text: easy to use. just pop the pot mostly together. drop in the optional filter. put in the grounds. then seal it up and apply some heat from a stove top (gas in my case). it is done a little bit after it starts to peculate (5 minutes). results in a much higher quality brew then i am used to. even with using the same amount of grounds and water. reliable, so used to electrical pots breaking after a year or so of use. usually breaking in a very dramatic fashion. this thing has no moving parts. no electrical parts at all. have used it daily since i bought it and it has shown no signs of wear or tear.
customer_reviews.author: Rusty Blair Edmiston

customer_reviews.text: Love everything about it except the glass part chipped while boiling I’ve had it maybe a month and I never dropped it I’m super careful with all my things Now I’m thinking what if I swallow it :| oh my .
customer_reviews.author: Yuri Arreguin

customer_reviews.title: Design flawed
customer_reviews.text: I enjoy percolated coffee, and I’m draw to the design simplicity of this product. However there is a design flaw, the curvature of the top prevents you from fully rinsing/draining when inverting with the lid removed. That convex edge retains water and stray coffee grounds that escape the basket. In theory you should be able to pour this residual water/grounds through the spout, but the opening to the spout is ever so slightly flared the wrong way, again trapping what you want to discard. Frustrating to fully clean and I tend to avoid using it as a result.
customer_reviews.author: Kensingtonian

customer_reviews.title: OMG the Good Coffee Life!
customer_reviews.text: Where has this pot been all my life!?! It’s now our go to coffee maker despite the fact that we own an imported Italian Gaggia which cost us Thousands! This pot has a secure lid unlike some of its competitors (I know this because I ordered 4 different percolators and returned them after doing extensive testing) A secure lid is crucial when it’s percolating! Really enjoy this pot. Coffee is spot on. We ground coffee daily and our house is full of its aromas. Returned the bigger 12 cup because it was too big for us. This 8 cup is a great buy and very well made.
customer_reviews.author: Red Geisha

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee, but be careful of the glass top
customer_reviews.text: This coffee Percolator makes fantastic coffee. It’s a fairly thick gauge stainless steel that heats up quickly. It does not work on my induction stove top but in my RV it makes coffee fairly quick on the gas burner. I love everything about it except for the fact that I opened my cabinet in the RV, and it fell on the floor and broke off the glass top. I have since ordered a replacement plastic top that I hope to use next week. I plan to store the top inside the coffee pot so if it does fall it won’t break the top again. I suggest you store it in the coffee ground bin while traveling.
customer_reviews.author: Rick C

customer_reviews.title: Glass piece sucks
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these in February 2019. Even with gentle daily use and proper handling/cleaning, I've had to replace each one i bought twice, due to the glass piece breaking and/or rust spots. Now I've got another broken glass piece and no way of replacing because I'm past the return/replacement time window. They're supposed to have a lifetime warranty and so now i have to jump through hoops to figure out how that works. If you want a convenient and quality item that doesn't require you to replace it several times, i suggest you find another percolator.
customer_reviews.author: ashley

customer_reviews.title: Good coffee, sturdy pot
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for camping and power outages. To go without morning coffee is just not living. It's been years since I perked a pot of coffee, but this brewed up a nice pot. I used regular drip pot filter poked over the stem in the basket to prevent grounds from getting in and it works just fine. Once you see perking start up into in the glass bulb, let it perk another 8 minutes or so, very good coffee. Nobody else in my family drinks coffee, but I went ahead and got the 12-cup anyway, works great and the handle is very sturdy, this should last years.
customer_reviews.author: Curt Brackenrich

customer_reviews.title: Great 12 Cup
customer_reviews.text: For camping we have the smaller 9 cup version of this peculator which we love. During the Pandemic, I decided I wanted a more robust cup of coffee and ordered the 12 cup for the house. This works perfectly. Put in your desired amount of coffee and water. Allow the coffee to perk 5-7 minutes and prepare to have a great up of coffee. The peculator is is stainless steel so avoid using harsh chemicals to clean. Should you have issues with cleaning, use a solution of 50% water and 50% white vinegar. The lid for the coffee grinds fits well and I've had no issues with grounds in the coffee. Would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: R. A. Kittle

customer_reviews.title: Nice to have great tasting coffee again!
customer_reviews.text: I got rid of the electric/plastic/8 cup coffee maker and bought this stainless steel percolator in hopes that our morning coffee would taste better than the bitter, murky coffee we've been making. We cleaned our coffee pot regularly inside and all the removable pieces every day but the longer we used it, the worse the coffee tasted. Without changing coffee brands, this percolator makes a smooth, delicious pot of coffee and now I know that every single piece is clean and ready for the next brew. Totally pleased and well worth the money. No filters, cups or other garbage to dispose of either.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Anderson

customer_reviews.title: The best camp coffee pot!
customer_reviews.text: The best camp coffee pot, period. You must, however, replace the small glass perc bubble with a Fitzall replacement percolator top. Do that as soon as you get it (The original is too fragile for camp use) and you have a durable, reliable camp coffee pot for thousands of uses. I know as I have used this pot at home, cabin or camp for years!!
customer_reviews.author: Outdoor Mom

customer_reviews.title: Lid hard to remove.
customer_reviews.text: It makes a decent cup of coffee, but the lid is VERY hard to remove, and the little perk knob is likely to come off if you pull too hard. This happened to me more than once. It might get easier over time as there are little grippers on the lid inside rim, and if they lose a bit of tension they might make it easier to get the lid off. I’ll have to see. As it is now, it’s not to my liking. Overall the pot is nice-looking, but it feels extremely lightweight. Would have liked better design regarding the lid and heavier gauge lid.
customer_reviews.author: Imo

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: I searched Amazon for a US made coffee pot and this one appeared. When I received it the box said Made in China. It was very deceptive that this coffee pot showed up in the search. I searched on US made because I wanted a quality product. Here it is two months later and the pot is unusable. The glass top broke when I pushed the lid on. I’ve already had to tighten the handle because it’s loose. I should’ve immediately returned it when I saw it was from China. This is exactly why I did not want a coffee pot from China!
customer_reviews.author: CB

customer_reviews.title: Good coffee!
customer_reviews.text: I write this review after only one use, so here goes. I love coffee, and drink it daily. I find this percolator (I have the 8 cup model) very easy to use. For my first pot, I followed the directions exactly, measuring everything to the specifications in the instruction book. My standby coffee is Folgers black silk. First pot was delicious. Strong, and piping hot. No bitterness. I am pretty impressed at this point. I will probably be making adjustments to the recipe in the future that will suit my taste. I also follow directions the first time I use something just to make sure. Can't wait to experiment with strength. Gonna try flavored coffee tomorrow.
customer_reviews.author: geo381

customer_reviews.title: I Finally switched to a percolator and love it.
customer_reviews.text: In the beginning I had to experiment with the amount of time percolating and the amount of coffee to use. Once I figured out what works best for me it is easy like Sunday morning. This pot has a mirror finish and just looks so much cooler than my old plastic ugly dripper. Easy to clean. No filters to buy. Gives off more aroma therapy, and soothing audio! And most importantly my purified water does not run through plastic and aluminum....gross. Still on the fence of whether to convert to percolator? You will be glad when you do so do it now!
customer_reviews.author: Billy Money

customer_reviews.title: Fragile Percolator bulb
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a simple use percolator, and I think I found it. HOWEVER, the bulb on the percolator shattered and ruined our fresh spring morning campsite pot of coffee...... sigh ... I almost drank the coffee anyway. ... The pot and lid look and feel pretty solid, but the bulb may have been defective. I'll be talking to the seller about it, and see if there is some grace as I just received it two weeks ago. I threw away the bulb as it was sharp.
customer_reviews.author: M.E. Design

customer_reviews.title: Faberware stood behind the warranty
customer_reviews.text: Like many other consumers have mentioned, the glass percolator knob developed a crack within the first month of use. However, I applaud Faberware for using a glass knob (who wants heated plastic in contact with their coffee), and for standing behind the warranty. I use it on a gas stove and the handle does not get hot, and has not been damaged by the heat. Overall the percolator has been very satisfactory, I would buy it again even knowing the problem with the knob
customer_reviews.author: H

customer_reviews.title: It’s true. The coffee is amazing.
customer_reviews.text: I don’t write these reviews often, but I just had to let everyone know that the reviews I read aren’t hype. The coffee really is that good. I never would have believed the difference if I didn’t try it myself. And no you don’t need to use a paper filter to avoid grounds in your coffee just wet the filter before you pour the coffee in. I’m actually waking up earlier in the morning to use it (it does take about 15 minutes longer than a drip maker). If you love coffee it’s a no brainer for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Bobbi

customer_reviews.title: Coffee must cook!
customer_reviews.text: Tried them all!! From cheap drips, to Italian flips, to vacuum systems, to conical gravitational pour throughs, including the bizarre metal mesh nonsense that clog, to my recent purchases of a Keurig. The latter, despite using a reusable k cup, and experimenting with a variety of filter media to slow down the injection process, could in no way produce a robust cup of coffee by injecting water, then air through coffee grounds in 30 seconds! The only other method is the tried and true French press. However it produces a cup that is not as hot as I like. So the only real way to actually "brew" coffee is to cook it, and this percolator fits the bill to perfection!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas J. Stratford

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this Farberware percolator after being disappointed with the Coletti "Bozeman" Percolator because it had such poor construction. The Farberware pot has been perfect so far. All the parts are high quality and fit together well. I've used it 3 times so far with no issues. The lid says on securely, but it not too tight (no need for a butter knife like previous reviewers!) I have been using wrap around paper filters so far because I had some coffee I wanted to use up, and the grind was too small for a percolator, but I am looking forward to trying it with some fresh coarse ground coffee soon.
customer_reviews.author: Irene Adler

customer_reviews.title: Best coffee flavor ever!
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to order this coffee pot. When I was growing up my mother always made coffee on the stove with a similar stainless steel coffee pot. The aroma was always wonderful and the taste incredible. I was sure my memory was just "enhanced" as it always does when it comes to mom's cooking. Well, I ordered in the pot and tried it over the weekend. It was wonderful! The taste of the coffee was perfect, delicious, and my house smelled amazing. Love my new coffee pot!
customer_reviews.author: TurquoiseMH

customer_reviews.title: Not what I was expecting...
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised at how large the larger pot was and wished I had gotten the smaller one. I had gotten rid of my larger Coffee maker with the hopes of a smaller visual impact in my new small kitchen. And unfortunately, in the process I learned that I was pretty spoiled with the other coffee maker. Since I had used it and thrown away my packaging I ended up sharing it with some person who shops at our local Goodwill. I'm positive that it is a wonderful product, but just not for me.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah

customer_reviews.title: It gets an "5" for
customer_reviews.text: Coffee pot was a fine for a camping experience but I wanted to try it and brew a full pot for coffee. I see and I observed a number of things. I real all pertinent information then set off to perc my first brew - a big step from a drip pot. It's a beautiful coffee pot but it takes 10 min. for it to boil, then another 5 minutes before the coffee had percolates sufficiently. It work fine but it takes a long time, as so most percolators. It seems like an camp stove pot will make you appreciate the home drip pot or Keurig .....
customer_reviews.author: Sweet Kitty

customer_reviews.title: The best way to brew coffee
customer_reviews.text: My father-in-law loved how the coffee from my 8 cup Farberware percolator tasted that I gave him mine and got a 12 cup to replace it. It takes longer to brew than other options, but this is a minor difference for a smoother and fuller bodied cup of coffee. I had to replace the glass knob in my original percolator, it broke quickly, but the replacement was only a few dollars. My original percolator held up for more than a decade, and now sits on my in-law's stove. Glad to have a bigger one for entertaining.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Meriwether

customer_reviews.title: Versatility?..its a coffee pot
customer_reviews.text: forgot all about perk coffee....we traded flavor and aroma for time and ease ....never again ! house smells like grandmoms with the coffee aroma..why...you are extracting at 212 degrees instead of 150 or 160 or 180...its easy but you have to watch it...follow directions bring to boil on med high...once perking...4 to 8 minutes(you have to do it yourself) turn off and take off stove...let rest for three minutes than pour a fab. cup
customer_reviews.author: Jefff

customer_reviews.title: great large 12 cup percolator! BEWARE you must clean/ first!
customer_reviews.text: This pot was exactly what we were looking for! 12 cups and non toxic stainless steel! The size is perfect for us to each have two cups of coffee and there's for o overflowing while percing that's to it's great design. Please note we have only used this a few days and will update if things go bad. The one very important thing to note is that you MUST clean and degrease the interior of this pot before use or your coffee will be horrific! See attached photos of just one paper towel after wiping the interior after previously washing it in hot soapy dishwater. We ended up using simple green degreaser!
customer_reviews.author: gsdxena

customer_reviews.title: Poorly made
customer_reviews.text: Bad out of the box. Glass dome and lid wouldn't stay assembled. If I had used this, there would have been boiling water shooting up into the air. I immediately returned this for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory M. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Makes great tasting coffee and quickly too
customer_reviews.text: I do love percolated coffee, so much more flavorful and it's noticeable to me as I drink coffee plain. This is my second purchase of this because the one that was 6 years old, the plastic top wouldn't stay in place any longer. It's easy to keep clean and from staining if it's rinsed well right away. My first one started to lose stability in the top part after it was being put in a dishwasher. I'd rather it be washed by hand so hopefully I can keep this one out of the dishwasher, seems to be too hard on it.
customer_reviews.author: Jayme

customer_reviews.title: Love brewed coffee
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this pot bc we frequently have power outages in my area and I needed stove top coffee.......have to have my morning coffee! However I find myself using this almost every day instead of my Kurig. The coffee ( I use Starbucks Verona) is robust and “natural” tasting. And my second cup stay just as hot as my first. My only issue is with cleaning. The top of the pot is turned under and causes a well at the top of the pot. It’s difficult to was wash the rinse . Not a big deal and I’m happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Gloria Dudas

customer_reviews.title: This is a MUST buy for coffee lovers
customer_reviews.text: Some of the best money I've ever spent. This is an "old school" unbelievable way of making coffee. What a treat. Well made. Easy to use. Yes, patience is needed because it's a 15 to 20 minute process but the end result is worth it. Cleaning is also somewhat of a process but no paper filters are necessary & It's all stainless steel.
customer_reviews.author: Louie

customer_reviews.title: Order an extra lid knob
customer_reviews.text: The percolator was received on time, boxing look great. Open percolator box and the lid knob was broken which make the percolator unusable. The knob is make of glass and I think Farberware should not install the knob in the lid when shipping, I saw some other reviews and they had the same problem. I order a knob with my purchase and glad I did. Until Farberware get the shipping correct, I surgest that when ordering this unit, also order a knob. I wash and clean the unit and perk my first cup. The flavor and taste was very good, I would recommend the unit with the purchase of a extra lid knob.
customer_reviews.author: GaPine

customer_reviews.title: Right size for two and nice for camping
customer_reviews.text: I never would have guessed that I'd enjoy percolator coffee. I've been using k-cups for so long. We wanted something practical and multi functional for the tiny camper and this fit the bill. We can use it inside or outside over propane. I watched a few videos on using one and all results have been amazing. I love that the coffee is really hot and stays that way. This unit is good quality and easy to clean. Just the right size for two of us to have several cups. I would buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Kelli Perkins

customer_reviews.title: SOOOOO SLLLLOOOOWWWW
customer_reviews.text: I typically drink 8 cups of coffee before work (my doctor told me to stay in single digits). I have tried drip coffee makers and found it to be a counter space hog. I have used stovetop Moka pots with great results. When I saw this stovetop coffee maker, I was excited. It took way too much time for the coffee to be fully done. For comparative, my 8 cup electric percolator takes about 6 minutes. After ten minutes, I turned off the stove. I would not recommend this for home use.
customer_reviews.author: AG

customer_reviews.title: GREAT coffee!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this model because I already had an 8-cup Farberware percolator (a smaller version of this one). I expected company over the holidays and wanted to be able to make more coffee at once. Just like the smaller version, which I've owned for almost a decade, this percolator makes incredible coffee! You'll need to experiment with coffee amounts and cooking times in order to find your "sweet spot". I now alternate this pot and the smaller one so that I always have one clean and ready to go.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Stein

customer_reviews.title: Had to replace glass knob
customer_reviews.text: I like the percolator and look forward to many years of use. I deducted one star because the glass knob that came with the percolator had nothing to hold it in place. It would just pull off when trying to remove the lid. I was able to purchase a replacement knob from Amazon which works perfectly, but I shouldn't have needed to make that additional purchase. The pot should come with a knob that fits securely.
customer_reviews.author: RSC

customer_reviews.title: Great percolator coffee pot...
customer_reviews.text: I wanted this for my camper so i'd have a solution I could use on a campfire, grill, in the caper on the stove, basically ANY cooking heat source. And this fits the bill. Plus, I remember when everyone had a percolator coffee pot, and that's just how coffee was made. So I guess a little nostalgia comes into play with my morning coffee when I'm on camping trips..
customer_reviews.author: roger wtaylor

customer_reviews.title: Wake Up, Get Up, Smell the Coffee!
customer_reviews.text: I use my water kettle to provide quick boiling water - while I measure out the coffee grounds. I find using no additional filters works best - no problem. Its difficult to see the cup numbers inside the pot - and I had to hunt under the handle to find the cup markings on the outside. Its good for 2 generous sized coffee mugs - 3 or 4 if you use 30 to 50% warm milk. I like the perks... and conversation around the pot for those 7 minutes- or dig and me bonding time before the herd cranks up Where's the CAUFEEEE... I CAN SMELL IT... UMMMMmmmmm
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: Makes great coffee
customer_reviews.text: This was third order of product which came in perfect. (Other 2 times I tried to save a bit by ordering Amazon warehouse- both had to be sent back as glass perc top was broken and would cost more to replace than ordering new). This product works great- makes enough coffee for at least 2 people or more if desired. Can adjust coffee strength by boiling longer. Like flavor better than made in single cup auto coffee maker. The only reason for 4 star is its very hard to empty completely because of curved design at top. Always keeps a bit of liquid in that inside rim. Other makes great coffee!
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Hendrix

customer_reviews.title: Yummy hot coffee!
customer_reviews.text: I love making coffee with this percolator. It fills the house with a delicious aroma that will make you smile. Clean up is easy. It took a couple of times to get the water to coffee ratio to my liking. I enjoy black coffee, very strong. In the past I've used a French press. Clean up was messy and the coffee wouldn't stay hot long enough. Not to mention the grounds on the bottom of my cup. For the past year I've been using a Melita pour over coffee maker. One cup at a time wasn't cutting it anymore. I am very happy with this percolator. I would recommend it without hesitation.
customer_reviews.author: Cat girl

customer_reviews.title: Good coffee
customer_reviews.text: It’s a learning curve to use going from drip , but better teast,& can be used camping or on a cook top wood stove, nice in the winter
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Solid coffee pot
customer_reviews.text: After a month of continuous use, I'm happy with the purchase. Coffee is simple to make and consistent from pot to pot. Brewing takes a little longer than some other methods, but that's good for developing patience. Clean up is a bit messier than methods using disposable filters or pods, but I knew that when I bought it. Quality and construction are good. The only challenges are removing the grounds before pouring--it's easy to get burned--and the difficulty in completely emptying the pot--the design is such that there are inevitably a couple tablespoons of liquid remaining in the pot.
customer_reviews.author: Noel H.

customer_reviews.title: It's a VERY NICE percolater!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I finally ordered this! While there are newer and faster ways of making coffee - I missed the smell and Sound of coffee percolating on the stove! Bloop bloop bloop! Makes me smile every morning. This is a very nice Faberware stainless steel coffeepot! I will order a replacement glass blub just to have on hand in case something happens to this one. This is what I remember from childhood days-Mom looking for a new bulb for the coffee pot and finding one for 25 cents! Grandpa thinking that was and "outrageous" price to pay!!! Oh the Good ole days!
customer_reviews.author: Kay

customer_reviews.title: Great Percolator with a flaw.
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice unit....except the glass percolator top. The first percolator came with the glass top broken upon arrival. Amazon took care of that and sent another. After a couple of uses the second glass broke and almost caused a nasty cut. So I went ahead and ordered a replacement top. A 2-pack. Of which one did not fit. Again Amazon took care of the problem. Just beware of the glass top of the percolator. Everything else is great. Thanks Amazon for your great customer service
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: Makes great coffee.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one of these a few years back for my in-laws. They love it and use it daily. I decided to get one for myself and have used it almost every day since. It is easy to clean and makes great coffee. If you don't know how to use one of these, there is a guy on YouTube that used this exact model to do his video. So far I love mine. We recently lost power for almost a week due to hurricane. I had a gas stove, but no way to make coffee. I do now.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very high quality
customer_reviews.text: There has come a time in America when cheap materials, poor design and shoddy workmanship are too often the norm. This percolator is reminiscent of the quality we would expect in the 1950s, a simple device that with care would last a century or more, working as it should and showing all the signs of pride of workmanship in 100 years that it was built with. My most sincere congratulations and admiration to Faber and its manufacturing for one of the best made products I've seen in a long, long time. It has served me admirably for two years and I expect it will ultimately be working as well for my grandchildren.
customer_reviews.author: a1623yankee

customer_reviews.title: Works for me
customer_reviews.text: Works well for me even just making 4 cups. Coffee tastes good. Requires only 1/2 the amount of coffee that my electric Percolator requires for the same darkness.Dispite the fact that a magnet does not stick to the bottom it does work on my counter top induction unit. Don't know how but it does.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Love at first cup
customer_reviews.text: For the last few months I've been using three different espresso pots. The old one leaked and couldn't find gasket to fit, but it never failed. The two new ones would occasionally make a full cup. Tried fine, medium, and coarse grinds, sometimes using both pots and neither worked...frustrating! This pot makes delicious coffee every time, which is what we're after right? Such a relief not having to wonder if I'm going to have coffee every morning. I love it! Very well made and durable. You can't go wrong here.
customer_reviews.author: DB

customer_reviews.title: This is a great coffee pot
customer_reviews.text: This is a great coffee pot. 20min to make 8 cups on a flattop stove. Coffee tastes much better than my electric percolator. I also purchased the Fitz-all glass replacement percolator, the pot comes with a plastic one. I also recommend the 3.5 inch Melba filters...absolutely no grounds found in my coffee. Just one tip when measuring coffee, one tablespoon per cup...use exact measurement to start then adjust to your taste and I have found that 5 min of perculating is more than adequate. Start your burner on high, the as soon as it starts to perculate tune burner down to med or med-low to finish.
customer_reviews.author: John Brunetti

customer_reviews.title: Unsatisfactory
customer_reviews.text: I followed the directions step by step AND consulted my friend who has the same percolator. I started with 4 cups of water with 4T coffee. Boiled at high for 5 minutes then low for 10 minutes. Nothing just hot water. I added 2 more cups of water, so 6c now, boiled on high for another 10 minutes, and low for 20 minutes. Brown tinted water (picture) but no brewed coffee, tasted like lightly flavored water. Terrible and I am returning, I will return to my pour over method.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Back to basics
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a good cup of coffee and my automatic coffee maker just wasn't doing the job. It's a little more hassle, because you have to set the pot up each morning and clean it out when it's done brewing, but the quality of the HOT cup of coffee is well worth the set up time and the wait while it perks. This percolator is easy to use, easy to clean and takes up very little space between uses. It's not for everyone, especially those with no patience, but if you want to get the best taste from your quality coffee, grind your own beans and perk it yourself.
customer_reviews.author: exrxfillr

customer_reviews.title: Get a better one
customer_reviews.text: Well when I first got this I loved it... Well not really I loved the concept of it. From the first cup there was a metal taste to the coffee. I figured I didn't wash it enough. Used it a second time same thing. Went to use it a third and noticed the glass top is now broken. How was this possible as noting gets stored on top of it and nothing touched it. This is just cheap garbage and not what you would expect from the Farberware name.
customer_reviews.author: Gomaan

customer_reviews.title: I'M NEVER USING A DRIP COFFEE MAKER AGAIN.
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this contraption and it has improved my mornings! As someone who loves piping hot coffee and usually has to put my cups of coffee into the microwave after brewing a cup with a coffee maker - I have to say I'm sooo pleased by the temperature and even taste of my coffee when it's made in this percolator. It also has an easy-to-grab handle and a very good pouring spout. This is a great price and your coffee will be HOT and taste wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: Jess Ade

customer_reviews.title: Induction works
customer_reviews.text: My main point of interest for this item was that it worked on an induction range. I have an older Samsung induction range and it works just fine. I like that the entire thing is stainless steel with no aluminum at all. The upper rim is curled inwards which makes it challenging to clean out coffee grounds. Those get stuck inside the rim and you have to slosh water back and forth inside the pot and try to drain it all out through the spout. If that isn't a big deal for you, you'll be very happy with how this works. Great tasing coffee and a good quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Jim McKinney

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: The coffee from this pot is so good and seemingly 10X higher in caffeine than my French Press. Who'd o' thunk? It is so worth the extra time and BS and there are no grounds in your cup. I speed the process buy pre-heating or I should say simultaneously heating 2/3-3/4 of the water in a tea kettle that covers our big turbo burner, as the flames shoot out past the perimeter of this pot. I then "carefully" assemble and let the thing just perk for 10 minutes. This is a well-made product that should last a lifetime with a few part replacements
customer_reviews.author: Greg West

customer_reviews.title: Useless after 5 months.
customer_reviews.text: We loved using this in the mornings. However we have only had 5 months and the percolator split down the side where it had been seemed together. So very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: E. Carr

customer_reviews.title: Simple and Delicious
customer_reviews.text: This percolator is perfect for a good personalized cup of coffee. You determine how much and what kind of coffee to put in the basket. It takes only ten minutes on my stove for the water to boil and percolate. You can let it percolate as long as you like to suite your taste. For me, two to three minutes makes for the best flavor. It cleans easily. I would recommend this to anyone. I bought a second one when my wife took our first one with her on a two month deployment.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Pereira

customer_reviews.title: Fragile glass knob... be careful!
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I was looking for and brews the best coffee ever!!!!! The downfall.... during the 2nd use the clear glass knob too broke and I can’t find the glass replacement anywhere... only plastic. Reason I purchased this was because there were no plastic pieces. I have continued to use the pot with the broken piece.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle  Altamirano

customer_reviews.title: Arrived broken...
customer_reviews.text: First of all, I think there must be some design flaw in the glass topper. It arrived broken in the package. Amazon sent a new one right away, but the glass topper broke within 4 uses. Amazon sent a third and it has been fine so far. Thank goodness Amazon has great customer service. I love the percolator otherwise. It does take about 15 min or so to boil and percolate, so be prepared for a little wait.
customer_reviews.author: Amatek

customer_reviews.title: Simple Design & Durable
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one that I purchased. My other one is still as good as the day I got it. Being Farberware it has high quality material and manufacturing. The basket is sturdy and doesn't need filters. I use flat filters or paper towel to keep from having to rinse it out as much. The basket stem is solid construction and doesn't loosen up over time like most others brands. The lid is snug and you never have to worry about it flopping off during pouring.
customer_reviews.author: Traveling Man

customer_reviews.title: Stainless steel classic perculator is the way to go!
customer_reviews.text: Love my stainless steel stove top peculator. I use it only for camping, usually on a camp stove but sometimes on a campfire's hot rocks. Works like a charm, makes a good pot of coffee and cleans up well. I also bought a pair of glass peculator tops as I read of the plastic ones melting down along with a pack of Melitta 3.5 Inch White Disc Percolator Coffee filters. The coffee pot is larger than I expected but no complaints here--yields about 4 large cups of coffee plus a medium size thermos fill and maybe a cup more.
customer_reviews.author: rodndtube

customer_reviews.title: best coffee ever
customer_reviews.text: I will be 72 in 2020, takes me back to a much relaxed way of life. takes awhile to brew a pot of coffee but well worth the wait. I have both the 8 cup for my boat, and 12 cup I use in the house. I use about 1/2 cup of grounds in the 8 cup, and 3/4 cup in the 12 cup. I perk my coffee about a minute per cup. boiled perk coffee I think makes the best coffee. done with keurig, mr coffee, bunn, and my electric pesto perculator. nothing makes better coffee than this pot. I use no paper filters, no need to, as I get virtually no grounds.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Yummy percolating coffee!
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to get this percolator! I have been doing research on different ones to get and this is closest to what I wanted for a good price. There’s lots of pieces to it so I read the instruction book before I started using it. Once I cleaned it, I was able to put my coffee grinds in the basket part of the percolator and sit on the stove. The percolator makes good strong coffee if that’s what you’re into. Overall, I’m very pleased with how this percolator makes coffee and I will definitely be using it in the future!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: There is a spring on the stem and a bump on the lid.
customer_reviews.text: I have not used the coffee pot but will soon. I can tell you I do not like the way it is put together....having the spring on the stem is just something to get lost very soon and having the bump on the lid makes it hard to put the lid on. I am 82 years old...just wanted a coffee pot easy to use and a less expensive coffee. I do not want the hassle of returning the coffee maker. I will return this item...I just removed the lid and the glass top had shattered inside. Jackie Smith
customer_reviews.author: Jackie Smith

customer_reviews.title: Nice percolator
customer_reviews.text: Percolator coffee does have a different taste than the drip makers, so my suggestion is to get this percolator and see for yourself. The only problem I have with it is the loose spring on the tube that keeps tension on the filter basket, when cleaning the percolator, you have to be careful not to lose the spring - I would like to see the spring captive on the tube, so it can't get lost, or always having to worry about losing it.
customer_reviews.author: S. Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for a camping trip, and now use it on Sunday mornings at home. Of course, it takes time to prepare coffee this way, but if you have the time; this is the ONLY way !!! Nothing like it. Cleanup is a p.i.t.a., but who cares. Once you get your measurements down, you'll love it. & this one is well made, a classic. Don't buy the speckled campy one just because it looks cool. Buy this one. Look up some pointers online, get a good course grind, and you're all set.
customer_reviews.author: JOE WIKERT

customer_reviews.title: Great Gift
customer_reviews.text: Got my boyfriend's mom's approval with this gift. She said she wanted a percolator, and quite honestly, I had not idea what a percolator was. I gave this to her, and she's able to make great coffee, and it is great for camping. It also looks cute (very rustic looking, and the clear top is fashionable). The instructions seemed a little confusing at first to me, but she seemed to be able to understand it easily and uses it often. I definitely recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: GoDawgs0506

customer_reviews.title: Great cup of coffee
customer_reviews.text: This percolator makes a great cup of coffee and well worth the 15-20 minute total cook time! I’ve had this pot for 7-8 months and use it only on the weekends, and just this past weekend the glass knob broke but not sure how. I was soooo bummed when I took it out to make coffee, I searched high and low for a replacement knob but could not find an adequate replacement so I caved and bought a universal plastic one and I really hope it works. Aside from that I contacted Farberware today and was told to file a warranty claim so I did, wish me luck cause I really really want my percolator to work.
customer_reviews.author: Evelyn Hernandez

product_meta.title: Farberware 50124 Classic Yosemite Stainless Steel Coffee Percolator - 8 Cup, Silver
product_meta.description:
Size:8-CupBrewing coffee on the stovetop extracts a fuller, richer flavor, and this Farberware Classic Series Stainless Steel 8-Cup Yosemite Stovetop Percolator is ready to brew four to eight cups of your favorite blends. Farberware has been trusted for over 100 years, and this stainless steel percolator continues that tradition for a new generation. The heavy-duty stainless steel is polished to a mirror finish for a classic touch and the sleek and traditional look fits in with any kitchen decor. A comfortable handle with iconic styling offers a confident grasp and is designed to provide a balanced grip while making coffee or pouring delicious French roasts or flavored coffee blends. A non-reactive coffee maker interior keeps water from absorbing any undesirable odors or tastes. And, with a permanent percolator filter basket, there's no need to deal with messy paper filters. A tight-fitting lid seals in heat and the sturdy, see-through glass knob lets you know when percolating begins and ends. Fully immersible and dishwasher safe, this percolator makes a great addition to any of the Farberware collections. Get back to basics, and enjoy more flavorful coffee, using the Farberware Classic Series Stainless Steel 8-Cup Stovetop Percolator.

AMAZON.COM
At the first morning sip you'll say, “Forget the espresso maker!” True connoisseurs know that the best coffee comes from a freshly percolated pot. This classic stainless steel model will provide long lasting beauty. Why not start an 'old tradition' with Sunday morning coffee in bed?
